intro: Iseilema thorelii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that can be either upright or trailing. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Iseilema thorelii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
